author: Mike Crawley
title: From 'risk is low' to calling in the army: 2 months of Ontario's COVID-19 response in long-term care
description: Two months ago, Ontario had just four confirmed cases of COVID-19. Now there are more than 12,000, and at least 759 people have died. This timeline shows what steps Ontario took — and failed to take — to protect the residents and staff of nursing homes.
content:
Two months ago, Ontario had just four confirmed cases of COVID-19. Now there are more than 12,000, and at least 759 deaths. Two-thirds of the dead lived in the province's long-term care homes.
This timeline shows what steps Ontario took and failed to take  t… [+12373 chars]
